channel.title: Video Rendering in Sony Vegas
channel.description:
I'm part of a growing YouTube team but when ever I try to render a project that is using plug-ins it always crashes or freezes. I will be buying an alienware after my brothers payments are done but I really need to render this as soon as I can. Does anyone know a fix?
If your wondering. [code]Manufacturer: TOSHIBA Model: Notebook Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM)2Duo CPU P7450 @ 2.13GHz 2.13 GHz Installed Memory (RAM): 4.00 GB (2.96 GB usable) System type: 32 bit[/code]
I know I'm an idiot for doing video editing on a laptop but I cant afford anything else atm.

item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

I’ve found a decent website http://pccasegear.com/
What would you guys suggest?

item.title: Video Rendering in Sony Vegas
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

It’s just like playing with expensive lego. It isn’t too hard to get it right, I’m sure the forum wouldn’t mind putting together a list of parts, and I’m sure there are video tutorials out there that go through the process of building a PC.

Read full topic

item.title: Video Rendering in Sony Vegas
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

tL:

Build one yourself and get 32GB of RAM!

I do love RAM. The only thing I’m scared of is breaking an expensive piece or buying the wrong brand or something so can someone tell me what I need. I know it’s spoon feeding but I really don’t want to fuck this up.

Read full topic

item.title: Video Rendering in Sony Vegas
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Build one yourself and get 32GB of RAM!

Also, it isn’t really a hassle. Two hours if you want to be neat and plan your cable management, much less if you have the space in your case to be messy.

Read full topic

Providing computer parts and hardware, hard drives, cameras and software as well as electronics, tools, appliances, sporting goods, jewelry, watches, gaming, and much more. With fast-shipping! Newegg shopping upgraded ™

Amazon is also good if it sells the same part for the same price, due to no taxes + extra financing benefits

item.title: Video Rendering in Sony Vegas
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

One of the main reasons I want the Alienware is because it has 16GB of RAM. It’s probably too much for one person I don’t wanna take a risk and have my major projects failing. Would anyone provide me a link to the best place to buy parts.

Read full topic

item.title: Video Rendering in Sony Vegas
item.dc:creator: @DEFET DEFET
item.description:
@DEFET wrote:

Buying a built brand-style computer for $3000 is probably as good as one you can build for ~$1000.

Really, I had no experience my first time either; Following online guides got the job done for me in a few days since I messed up badly >.>

It’s really worth it, though. If you’ve seen some of my previous threads/posts you could see I had troubles, but they were solved and you shouldn’t have trouble if you have some with yours.

Read full topic

item.title: Video Rendering in Sony Vegas
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:7, topic:424734”][quote author=cooper link=topic=527396.msg3844883#msg3844883 date=1323548669]
if you want a laptop, i’d suggest a sager
desktop, build it yourself
[/quote]
Desktop ofc.

what other options do i have? I have no experience with making one so gf.

Building a computer is so unbelievably easy. Let us know how much money you got and someone will post back with the items you’ll need. Also where are you from so we know which website to look on.

I have around $2500. $3000 if I really need to squeeze out a bit more.[/quote]
You’ll get a speljohan_ style rig with that sort of money…

Read full topic
